Authors:
Alcindo da Silva Martins Junior, Cassia Monica Sakuragui,
Anibal Alves Carvalho Junior
Title:
A new species of Neotropical Spumula collected in the Parque
Nacional do Itatiaia, Brazil
Keywords:
Pucciniales, Uredinales, Taxonomy, Plant Pathogen,
Raveneliaceae, Rust fungi
Abstract:
A new species of rust fungi, Spumula itatiensis on Senegal
pedicellata, in the Parque Nacional do Itatiaia, Rio de Janeiro (Brazil)
is described and illustrated. To clarify their phylogenetic
relationships, a dataset was generated containing sequences of nuclear
DNA from the ribosomal largest subunit 28S (LSU) composed of holotype
and other Raveneliaceae representatives, available in the GenBank, for
analysis of Maximum likelihood and Bayesian inference. Morphologically,
S itatiaiensis is characterized by the teliospore head without
ornamentation, echinulated urediniospores with 6-8 germ pores and
uredinial and telial paraphyses chambered. Phylogenetically is closely
related to species Ravenelia, genus of which Spumula differs by the
presence of a single pedicel. This is the second species of Spumula to
Brazil.
